fields.summary: Resolve the Initial Numerology Map

issuetype.description: Tasks track small, distinct pieces of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Objective:
Interpret and refine the initial numerology map to establish a clear framework that outlines the relationships between different elements, ensuring the logic aligns with project goals.
Steps to Execute:
Analyze the Current Numerology Map:
Review the initial map to understand its structure, logic, and intended purpose.
Identify inconsistencies, gaps, or ambiguities in the relationships and rules defined in the map.
Define Key Elements:
Break down the map into its core components (e.g., numbers, attributes, relationships).
Categorize elements and establish clear definitions for each.
Validate Logical Consistency:
Verify that the rules and relationships in the map are logically consistent.
Cross-check any dependencies or formulas to ensure accuracy.
Enhance the Map:
Resolve ambiguities by refining relationships and rules.
Add missing elements or connections to create a comprehensive and coherent framework.
Finalize the Map:
Consolidate the refined numerology map into a structured format, such as a graph, table, or annotated diagram.
Ensure that the map is scalable and can integrate seamlessly with subsequent project components.
Deliverables:
A refined and logically consistent numerology map, ready for integration with other project elements.
This task creates a solid foundation for leveraging the numerology map in the application's workflow, supporting accurate and scalable logic implementation.

fields.summary: Iteratively Resolve One Example for Each of the Different Question Types

issuetype.description: Tasks track small, distinct pieces of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Objective:

Analyze and resolve a representative example for each of the identified question types, ensuring a thorough understanding of their structure, logic, and dependencies. This iterative process will create a reusable framework for handling similar questions in the future.
Steps to Execute:
Identify Question Types:
Review the list of different question types (e.g., multiple choice, numeric input, matching, etc.).
Select one representative example for each type.
Analyze the First Example:
Break down the chosen example into its core components (e.g., inputs, outputs, rules, constraints).
Trace its dependencies within the application logic.
Resolve the Example:
Implement logic to handle the specific question type.
Ensure that input, processing, and output mechanisms align with the requirements for that type.
Iterate for Each Type:
Repeat the process for the remaining question types.
Address nuances and unique aspects of each type during their resolution.
Refactor and Generalize:
Identify commonalities among the resolved examples.
Abstract reusable logic into a shared framework or utility.
Validate the Framework:
Test the resolved examples to ensure they function correctly and consistently.
Adjust the implementation as needed to account for edge cases or complexities.
Deliverables:
Resolved examples for each question type.
A preliminary framework or set of utilities for handling all question types efficiently.
This task ensures that all question types are well-understood and provides a scalable approach to managing them within the application.

fields.summary: Quality Checkup Control

issuetype.description: Tasks track small, distinct pieces of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Objective:
Conduct a comprehensive quality check to ensure all components of the system meet the required standards for functionality, performance, and scalability.
Steps to Execute:
Define Quality Metrics:
Identify key metrics for assessing the quality of the system (e.g., functionality correctness, response time, scalability benchmarks).
Perform Functional Validation:
Verify that all components (e.g., BLL, question type handlers, numerology map) operate as expected.
Check edge cases and ensure error handling is robust.
Assess Integration Consistency:
Ensure all integrated components work seamlessly together.
Validate that data flows correctly between modules without bottlenecks or errors.
Test Scalability:
Simulate increased loads to test the systems ability to scale effectively.
Confirm that performance remains within acceptable limits under stress.
Check Code Quality:
Review the codebase for adherence to best practices, readability, and maintainability.
Identify and address any technical debt or inefficiencies.
Evaluate Performance:
Measure key performance indicators (KPIs) such as response time, throughput, and resource utilization.
Optimize any areas that fall short of expectations.
Conduct Final Validation:
Confirm that the system meets all functional and non-functional requirements.
Ensure the service is ready for deployment or handoff to stakeholders.
Deliverables:
A report or checklist confirming the quality of the system.
Recommendations for improvements, if necessary.
Assurance that the system is ready for operational use.
This task ensures the project achieves a high standard of quality, providing confidence in its readiness for deployment or further scaling.

fields.summary: Integrate into a Scalable Service

issuetype.description: Tasks track small, distinct pieces of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Objective:
Integrate the resolved components into a scalable service architecture, ensuring that the system can handle current requirements efficiently and expand to accommodate future growth.
Steps to Execute:
Define Service Requirements:
Outline the functional and non-functional requirements of the service, including performance, scalability, and reliability goals.
Design the Service Architecture:
Establish a modular architecture that integrates all components (e.g., BLL, numerology map, question type handlers).
Define clear boundaries and interfaces for each module.
Set Up the Hosting Environment:
Choose a suitable hosting platform (e.g., cloud-based services, on-premises deployment).
Configure the infrastructure for scalability (e.g., containerization using Docker, load balancing, or horizontal scaling).
Implement Service Logic:
Combine the decoupled components into a unified service.
Implement communication protocols (e.g., REST API or gRPC) to expose functionalities to clients.
Optimize for Scalability:
Use stateless service design where applicable to facilitate horizontal scaling.
Implement caching and database optimization to handle high loads efficiently.
Test the Service:
Perform integration tests to ensure all components work together seamlessly.
Conduct load testing to validate scalability under different traffic scenarios.
Deploy and Monitor:
Deploy the service to the hosting environment.
Set up monitoring and alerting tools to track performance, errors, and usage patterns.
Deliverables:
A fully integrated and deployed scalable service.
Configurations and optimizations to support current and future needs.
Monitoring mechanisms for ongoing operational insights.
This task ensures that the project transitions into a robust, production-ready system capable of supporting users efficiently and scaling as needed.

fields.summary: Identify All Uses of Windows Forms References (Input, Output, and Constraints)

issuetype.description: Tasks track small, distinct pieces of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Objective:

Analyze the codebase to determine how each Windows Forms reference is being utilized. Specifically, identify controls used for input, output, and those with input constraints, mapping their roles and interactions within the application.
Steps to Execute:
Load the Windows Forms Dictionary:
Use the previously created dictionary of Windows Forms references as the basis for this analysis.
Ensure all controls and dependencies are accounted for.
Analyze Input Controls:
Identify controls used for user input (e.g.,
TextBox
ComboBox
RadioButton
Track methods and logic handling user input, including validation and event subscriptions.
Analyze Output Controls:
Identify controls used for output (e.g.,
Label
DataGridView
PictureBox
Trace how these controls are updated or populated with data, including any logic tied to their display.
Analyze Input Constraints:
Detect constraints applied to input controls (e.g., regex validation, required fields, or max length properties).
Map these constraints to their associated controls and capture the validation logic.
Build a Usage Map:
Create a detailed mapping of each control and its use case, including:
Control type and name.
Role (input, output, or both).
Associated constraints or dependencies.
Verify Accuracy:
Cross-check a sample of the analysis to ensure completeness and correctness.
Address any gaps or inconsistencies in the usage map.
Deliverables:
A comprehensive usage map detailing how each Windows Forms control is utilized within the application, categorized by role and constraints.
This task ensures a clear understanding of control usage, enabling precise decoupling and refactoring in later steps.

fields.summary: Identify All Windows Forms References in the Code and Build a Dictionary

issuetype.description: Tasks track small, distinct pieces of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Objective:

Analyze the codebase to identify all references to Windows Forms components, including controls, events, and other dependencies. Create a structured dictionary to catalog these references for further analysis.
Steps to Execute:
Parse the Codebase:
Use Roslyn APIs or other code analysis tools to systematically parse the entire codebase.
Focus on files where Windows Forms components are likely to be used.
Extract Windows Forms References:
Identify all references to
System.Windows.Forms
and its components, such as controls, events, and other UI-related elements.
Capture all instances of control declarations, event handlers, and UI-specific logic.
Catalog References:
Build a dictionary or equivalent data structure to store the references.
Organize the dictionary with keys representing control names or types and values detailing their usage, properties, and locations in the code.
Group and Classify:
Classify references by type (e.g., input controls, output controls, layout elements) for easier analysis.
Note any patterns or frequent dependencies for later refactoring steps.
Validate the Dictionary:
Ensure that all references are captured accurately.
Cross-check a subset of the code manually to verify the completeness of the analysis.
Deliverables:
A comprehensive dictionary or equivalent data structure listing all Windows Forms references, categorized and detailed by type and location within the codebase.
This task provides a foundational understanding of the UI dependencies in the code, enabling effective decoupling and modularization in subsequent steps.
